result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order to Withdraw as Attorney of Record
for Atty Barth to withdraw as Attorney of record

10:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Drew Lehman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Edward T. Combs in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Edward T. Combs. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF828/22CF320/22CF1115. Victim rights compliance. Attorney Barth advises the Court that the DE is requesting he withdraw from these cases. Discussion held. Court will allow Attorney Barth to withdraw from these cases. SPD Office shall appoint new counsel. Attorney Barth to notify the SPD Office.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

NO RECORD.   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant appeared in custody. Attorney Barth is currently in trial in Branch 2. ADA Smathers advises the Court that she can come in on one of her off weeks. Notice will be sent out. Attorney Barth appears late; JPTC rescheduled with Attorney Barth and ADA Smathers for 9/30/22 at 9:30 am.
Case moved to br 6 to follow the corresponding cases and co defendant case.

Defendant, Edward T. Combs, appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
